Architecture

Dev Autopilot

On this page

Dev Autopilot: Free CI, Security Scans, Renovate, and Local AI Helpers ​

This document outlines the comprehensive development automation setup implemented for the Political Sphere project.

Overview ​

The Dev Autopilot setup provides enterprise-grade development tooling including:

  • CI/CD Pipeline: Automated testing, linting, and security scanning
  • Security: Multi-layered security scanning and policy enforcement
  • Automation: Dependency updates and PR management
  • AI Assistance: Local AI helpers for commit messages and PR reviews
  • Documentation: Automated documentation linting and building

CI/CD Pipeline ​

Quality Checks (ci.yml) ​

The main CI pipeline runs on every PR and push to main:

yaml
- Linting (ESLint, Prettier)
- Type checking (TypeScript)
- Unit testing with coverage (Node.js test + c8)
- E2E testing (Playwright)
- Documentation linting (markdownlint, cspell)
- Security scanning (Gitleaks, CodeQL)
- Policy enforcement (Conftest)
- Container scanning (Hadolint)
- Infrastructure scanning (tfsec, Checkov)

Test Coverage ​

Unit tests now include coverage reporting using c8:

bash
npm run test:unit  # Generates text and LCOV reports

Coverage reports are uploaded to Codecov in CI.

Security & Compliance ​

Multi-Layered Security ​

  1. Gitleaks: Scans for secrets in code and commits
  2. CodeQL: Advanced static analysis for vulnerabilities
  3. Conftest: Policy-as-code validation using OPA
  4. Container Security: Hadolint for Dockerfile best practices
  5. Infrastructure Security: tfsec and Checkov for Terraform

Policies ​

OPA policies enforce:

  • No :latest image tags
  • No privileged containers
  • No hostPath volumes

Dependency Automation ​

Renovate ​

Automated dependency updates with:

  • Grouped updates for related packages
  • Schedule-based updates
  • PR size limits and auto-merging

AI-Powered Development ​

Local AI Helpers ​

Three Node.js scripts provide AI assistance without external API calls:

Commit Message Helper (dev/ai/commit-msg.mjs) ​

Generates conventional commit messages from staged changes.

bash
npm run ai:commit

PR Description Helper (dev/ai/pr-desc.mjs) ​

Creates detailed PR descriptions from commit history.

bash
npm run ai:pr

PR Review Helper (dev/ai/review-pr.mjs) ​

Provides automated code review feedback.

bash
npm run ai:review

PR Management ​

Auto-Labeling (.github/labeler.yml) ​

Automatically labels PRs based on file paths:

  • ci, dev, docs, infrastructure, platform

PR Size Labels (.github/pr-size.yml) ​

Categorizes PRs by size:

  • XS (<10 lines), S (<100), M (<500), L (<1000), XL (≥1000)

Stale Management (.github/stale.yml) ​

Automatically manages stale issues and PRs.

Git Hooks & Standards ​

Lefthook Configuration (.lefthook.yml) ​

Pre-commit hooks run:

  • lint-staged on changed files
  • commitlint for conventional commits

Commit Standards ​

Enforces conventional commits with commitlint.

Documentation ​

Automated Linting ​

  • markdownlint: Style and formatting checks
  • cspell: Spell checking
  • Vale: Prose linting (optional)

VitePress Site ​

Documentation served at docs/ with build output to docs-dist/.

Local Development ​

Scripts Available ​

json
{
  "lint": "eslint . --ext .ts,.tsx --max-warnings=0",
  "typecheck": "tsc -p tsconfig.base.json --noEmit",
  "test:unit": "c8 --reporter=text --reporter=lcov node --test tests/unit/**/*.test.mjs",
  "test:e2e": "npx playwright test --reporter=html",
  "docs:lint": "markdownlint **/*.md && cspell '**/*' --no-progress",
  "docs:build": "vitepress build docs --out docs-dist",
  "docs:serve": "vitepress dev docs --port 5173",
  "ai:commit": "node dev/ai/commit-msg.mjs | head -n 20",
  "ai:pr": "node dev/ai/pr-desc.mjs | head -n 40",
  "ai:review": "node dev/ai/review-pr.mjs"
}

Troubleshooting ​

Lefthook Not Working ​

bash
npm run prepare  # Reinstalls hooks

Tests Failing ​

  • Check for flaky tests (CI retries enabled)
  • Ensure Node.js test syntax is correct
  • Verify coverage configuration

Renovate Not Creating PRs ​

  • Check .github/renovate.json configuration
  • Verify repository permissions

CodeQL Not Running ​

  • Enable in repository settings under Security > Code scanning

Performance & Optimization ​

  • Parallel Jobs: CI runs quality, containers, and IaC checks in parallel
  • Caching: Nx cache and npm cache reduce build times
  • Retry Logic: Failed tests retry once in CI
  • Sharding: Playwright tests support sharding for large test suites

Future Enhancements ​

Potential additions for enterprise-grade setup:

  • SBOM generation (Syft)
  • Performance monitoring (Lighthouse CI)
  • Accessibility testing (axe-core)
  • License compliance checking
  • Multi-environment deployments

This setup provides a solid foundation for scalable, secure, and efficient development workflows.
